column1: Microsoft Student Partner Applications 07/08 Now Open!

Applications for the Microsoft Student Partners (MSP) programme 07/08 are now open. If you are a student passionate about technology, ready to share your knowledge and want to develop skills outside your field of study, Microsoft want to hear from you. You will need to download and complete the MSP application form. You must send the complete form to ukmspnom@microsoft.com. The closing date for applications is Saturday 26 May 2007. Microsoft will then review all the submitted applications and select the brightest and most innovative student developers and technology enthusiasts from universities across the UK and Ireland.
Gap Year Jobs and Working Holiday Placements.

GLOBAL CHOICES is an organisation based in London and involved in international educational and cultural exchanges. They offer a variety of job placements abroad for students, young professionals and other participants from the UK and internationally. Their Programmes are classified in 5 types: Working Holiday, Internships, Teaching Abroad, Volunteering and Courses.

Find out more at www.globalchoices.co.uk
BUNAC Educational Scholarship Trust Scholarships & Travel Awards 2007

BEST Scholarships - these are open to applicants who are, UK Citizens, who have been in full-time tertiary education at a University in the UK within the last 5 years & intending to undertake postgraduate study in North America in 2007/8. Awards are normally in the region of $5,000 - $10,000. CLOSING DATE FOR APPLICATIONS IS 16 MARCH 2007.

BEST Travel Awards - these awards are for undergraduates who are undertaking a year of study in the USA in 2007/8. Applicants should be UK Citizens, who are currently in full-time tertiary education and returning to full-time education after the period of study in the USA. Applicants should be applying for a study abroad period at a US college/university as part of a UK based undergraduate degree course & the study abroad period must be for one academic year. CLOSING DATE FOR APPLICATIONS IS 23 MARCH 2007. The minimum award available is $1000 which is to be used towards the cost of travel.
BioDundee is a local partnership that promotes the growth of life sciences in the Dundee area and brings together the public, private and academic sectors
Pick up the latest copy of Doctor Job and you could be in with a chance to win a NEW CAR!!
Doctor Job's Little Black Book
Pick up your FREE copy of the latest web directory of employers and courses at the Career Development Centre.
Life Sciences Scotland Source Book 2006/7

The Life Sciences Scotland Source Book is the essential reference guide to Scottish life sciences companies and academic institutes. The database contains details of organisations involved in research, products and technology development, and services and support.

Available to view online at
www.lifesciencesscotland.com

A hard copy is also available for reference only in the Career Development Centre.
Futuretrack2006 - the biggest study of student and graduate development ever undertaken!

Futuretrack2006 is happening NOW!

Have you just started as a first year student on a Higher Education course this autumn?

Have you completed a FutureTrack questionnaire?

If you have not yet done so, this is definitely for you.

Join now and be part of the largest UK graduate career related study undertaken and have the opportunity of winning prizes as well.

Whether you applied through UCAS or applied directly to your institution you are invited to take part in Futuretrack2006. It is an exciting major 6-year study exploring the experiences of students applying for university/college in 2006 and tracking career decision making as they move through their studies and into employment.

This site will be developed to keep you in touch with what is happening to students in your year and give you the opportunity to win further prizes in the future.

See www.hecsu.ac.uk and enter the Futuretrack2006 portal (red icon) on the homepage.
ADVICE AND GUIDANCE ON APPLYING FOR POSTGRADUATE TEACHER TRAINING

Information on teacher training in Scotland, England & Wales and Northern Ireland and applying for a Postgraduate Certificate in Education can be found in the Education sector under Communities on

www.prospects.ac.uk

This site provides a great deal of information on applying though the GTTR clearing house as well as top tips on completing the application online.

Apply is the online application system for applicants to PGCE teacher training courses through GTTR (Graduate Teacher Training Registry). For further information on Apply and GTTR see gttr.ac.uk

Please note that the Closing Date for applications for primary teaching to reach GTTR is 1st December 2006 for autumn 2007 entry but in order to allow enough time for your referee to be contacted, you should send your application in by mid November at the latest.

Applications are processed by the GTTR in date of receipt order and dispatched to the institutions concerned once a week so if you are considering applying to teacher training, the sooner you send off your application the better.

If you have any questions re the application process and/or wish a Careers Adviser to look over your application form, please call in to the Careers Service. Please note that there will be a presentation on teaching in the University on Tuesday 7th November 2006 - see forthcoming events for further details.
Latest information just arrived in the Careers Service.....

The new employer directories for 2007 are available in the Career Development Centre along with lots of free copies of glossy careers magazines including the latest edition of Prospects Finalist with articles on making the Most of Your Final Year, Inside Graduate Training Schemes, Volunteer Overseas and the Perfect Application. So come and collect your copies before supplies run out!
